TextBody:
Hi Veronica,

I have just received an update from our colleagues regarding the possibility to run a script that clears the boot partition, that presented issues when upgrading the EPP server.

At the moment we unfortunately do not have an automated script for this. It is still being worked on. My colleagues recommended, in case the issue persists after migrating to hosted by us, to clear the space as we did till now, until the script is implemented.

Please let me know if we can close this ticket.

Best Regards,
Flaviu Moldovan | Technical Support Engineer
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix
DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption
www.endpointprotector.com

--------------- Original Message ---------------
From: Netwrix Support [techsupport@netwrix.com]
Sent: 9/27/2024 9:05 PM
To: vyessa@chapman.com
Subject: Re: Netwrix Support Ticket #420321 - - Backend Security Updates does not work for several EPP server Upgrade versions [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0FQwHU:ref ]

Hi Veronica,

Thank you for the remote session!

As we spoke we applied the clean boot partitions steps and then we were able to apply the updates.

We will leave this ticket open till we receive updates from our colleagues regarding the fact that this is a reoccurring issue.

I will let you know as soon as I receive any news.

Best Regards,
Flaviu Moldovan | Technical Support Engineer
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix
DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption
www.endpointprotector.com

Thanks, 

 

- Verónica

Date: Friday, September 20, 2024 at 4:01 PM
To: Veronica Yessa <vyessa@chapman.com>
Subject: Re: Netwrix Support Ticket #420321 - - Backend Security Updates does not work for several EPP server Upgrade versions [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0FQwHU:ref ]

Flaviu Moldovan | Technical Support Engineer

DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption

--------------- Original Message ---------------
From: Veronica Yessa [vyessa@chapman.com]
Sent: 9/20/2024 10:35 PM
To: techsupport@netwrix.com
Subject: Re: Netwrix Support Ticket #420321 - - Backend Security Updates does not work for several EPP server Upgrade versions [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0FQwHU:ref ]

ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000FQwHU:ref

 


Something odd is going on with the server and I cannot tell what is happening in terms of updates.  I have a whole lot of vulnerabilities piling up, so I checked the backend updates.  I saw this:

 



As you can see, it is a large list. 

 

I installed and then went to verify that the install worked because of this issue, but the admin actions log shows blanks for everything – even the check of the backend updates as well as the Apply.”

 



 

 

I cannot tell what is happening here – if the UI is failing or the report is not working or what, but I am up to 16 vulnerabilities.  I would think at least some of them should be resolvable. 

- Verónica

 





From: Netwrix Support <techsupport@netwrix.com>
Date: Wednesday, September 18, 2024 at 7:45?AM
To: Veronica Yessa <vyessa@chapman.com>
Subject: Re: Netwrix Support Ticket #420321 - - Backend Security Updates does not work for several EPP server Upgrade versions [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0FQwHU:ref ]


Hi Veronica,

I have followed up with my colleagues on this and asked them to provide an update on it.

I will get back to you as soon as I hear back from them.

Best Regards,
Flaviu Moldovan | Technical Support Engineer

- Verónica

For the OpenSSL Vulnerabilities our devs said it will be address in the next image.

I have also chased with my colleagues the internal ticket regarding the upgrading of the EPP server and the backend security updates not applying.

I will let you know as soon as I have more information on this.

Best Regards,
Flaviu Moldovan | Technical Support Engineer

- Verónica
